ThemeSettings.description: Settings for customizing the look and feel of the website.

meta.description: Metadata concerning the website as a whole, like the website title.

title.description: A title for the website, which will be appended to the title of the page in the HTML `<title>` tag with the `"|"` character separating the two.

theme.description: Settings concerning the visual appearance of the website and the styling of its components.

border-radius.description: The CSS border-radius value used globally for elements like code listings and asides.

indentationWidth.description: The number of spaces used to indent multi-parameter Swift symbol declarations.

colors.description: An object where each key represents the name of a color variable referenced in the renderer. A CSS property in the form `--color-[key]` will either be created or overwritten with the value associated with it.

icons.description: An object where each key represents a kind of icon used in the website which can be overwritten by providing a relative or absolute URL to an alternate SVG asset.

html-font.description: The CSS font-family value to be used globally for text in documentation.

html-font-mono.description: The CSS font-family value to be used for monospaced code-voice text in documentation.

features.description: Flags for enabling or disabling features of the website.

docs.description: flags for enabling or disabling `/documentation` page features.

oneOf.description: A map of light and dark CSS color values to use as appropriate.

URL.description: An absolute URL or relative path.
